entry.title: Fluid Typography: Predicting A Problem With Your User’s Zoom-In
entry.summary: In this article, Ruslan Yevych will show you an easy way how to predict the appearance of a problem known as WCAG Failure Under 1.4.4 Resize Text (AA) while zooming the page. You will have a clear understanding of the possible risks of using responsive typography at the stage of development.

The first one was published in 2007, the same year CSS-Tricks began, and it continued all the way through 2021… Thank You (2022 Edition) originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: A Guide To Command-Line Data Manipulation
entry.summary: No more random scripts in Python and JavaScript to transform CSV or JSON data. In this article, Alvin Bryan shows you how to use Miller, a small and powerful CLI tool, to do all your data processing.

entry.title: Deploying CSS Logical Properties On Web Apps
entry.summary: You may have already heard of CSS logical properties or RTL adaptations but are still deciding whether to deploy them widely. To help raise your awareness of their possibilities, Nicolas Hoffmann shares his experience of how he and his team at Proton carried out a massive move from CSS logical props to production and how you can consider them from a different perspective in your very own projects.

entry.title: Useful Accessibility And Usability Examples To Help Improve Your Designs
entry.summary: In this article, Thomas Bohm shares strategies and methods to tackle some common graphic communication problems and gives you insights into how to improve accessibility and usability and make your designs much better.

entry.title: Taking The Stress Out Of Design System Management
entry.summary: In this article, Masha goes over five tips that make it easier to manage a design system while increasing its effectiveness. This short guide is aimed at smaller teams.
